pkgmetadata.longdescription: Linear Model Evaluation with Randomized Residuals in a Permutation Procedure // Linear model calculations are made for many random versions of data. Using residual randomization in a permutation procedure, sums of squares are calculated over many permutations to generate empirical probability distributions for evaluating model effects. This method is described by Collyer, Sekora, Adams (2015) doi:10.1038/hdy.2014.75.
